title: 110_s2775
content: The "Fair Share Act of 2008" may be cited as the short title. Certain domestically controlled foreign persons performing services under contract with the United States government are treated as American employers. The "Fair Share Act of 2008" treats certain foreign persons working under US government contracts as American employers for FICA tax purposes. The term 'controlled group of entities' refers to a group of corporations with the common parent being a domestic corporation, defined with a substitution of 'more than 50 percent' for 'at least 80 percent' and without considering specific subsections. Additionally, partnerships or other non-corporate entities can be included in a controlled group if they meet certain criteria. The term 'controlled group of entities' refers to a group of corporations with the common parent being a domestic corporation, defined with a substitution of 'more than 50 percent' for 'at least 80 percent' and without considering specific subsections. In cases of liability, the common parent of a domestically controlled group is jointly and severally liable for any tax owed by a foreign person within the group. For relief from taxes under certain international agreements, refer to sections 3101(c) and 3111(c). Additionally, amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to the definition of the term 'Social Security Benefits'.
